alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Essex; Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:25PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Caledonia, northeastern Orleans and Essex Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 224 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ferdinand, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Island Pond, Lyndon, Charleston, Canaan, West Burke Village, Westmore, East Haven, Morgan, Ferdinand, Granby, Warren Gore, Averys Gore, Victory, Burke, Brunswick, Willoughby, Bloomfield, Brighton, Sutton and Norton. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 142 and 152. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern Vermont.
